message.content:
Cirsium occidentale is a species of thistle found in the western part of North America.

The plant has spiny stems and leaves, and can grow up to 2 meters tall.

The flowers of Cirsium occidentale are bright pink or purple, and are arranged in spherical clusters.

The leaves are lance-shaped and have a green-grey color with small prickles on the edges.

Cirsium occidentale is generally found in mountain meadows, grasslands and open forests.

It is commonly used as an ornamental plant in gardens and landscaping.

Cirsium occidentale is an integral part of the ecosystem as it provides food and habitat for many species of birds, insects, and mammals.
